 * एस. 2565 (110वां): कानून प्रवर्तन कांग्रेसनल बैज ऑफ ब्रेवरी एक्ट 2008 [ https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/110/s2565 ]
 * एस. 3061 (110वां): विलियम विल्बरफोर्स ट्रैफिकिंग पीड़ित संरक्षण पुनर्प्राधिकरण अधिनियम 2008 [ https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/110/s3061 ]
 * एस. 3218 (110वां): आपराधिक इतिहास पृष्ठभूमि जांच पायलट एक्सटेंशन अधिनियम 2008 [ https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/110/s3218 ]
 * एस. 2731 (110वां): टॉम लैंटोस और हेनरी जे. हाइड यूनाइटेड स्टेट्स ग्लोबल लीडरशिप अगेंस्ट एचआईवी/एड्स, ट्यूबरकुलोसिस, एंड मलेरिया रीऑथराइजेशन एक्ट 2008 [ https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/110/s2731 ]
ओबामा ने केवल दयनीय 4 बिल अधिनियमित किए थे - यहां कुछ हैं: ओबामा 4 बिलों के प्राथमिक प्रायोजक थे जो अधिनियमित हुए थे: * एस. 906 (110वां): पारा निर्यात प्रतिबंध अधिनियम 2008 [ https://www.govtrack. हमें/कांग्रेस/बिल/110/एस906 ]
 * एस. 1513 (110वां): मुख्य रूप से ब्लैक इंस्टीट्यूशन अधिनियम 2007 [ https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/110/s1513 ]
 * एस. 2125 (109वां): कांगो लोकतांत्रिक गणराज्य राहत, सुरक्षा और लोकतंत्र संवर्धन अधिनियम 2006 [ https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/109/s2125 ]
 * एस. 3757 (109वां): ईस्ट सेंट लुइस, इलिनोइस में 950 मिसौरी एवेन्यू पर स्थित संयुक्त राज्य डाक सेवा की सुविधा को "कैथरीन डनहम पोस्ट ..." के रूप में नामित करने के लिए एक विधेयक। .us/कांग्रेस/बिल/109/s3757 ]
ओबामा ने सीनेट में कुल 8 वर्षों तक सेवा की। उससे पहले यहां कुछ चीजें हैं जिन्हें उन्होंने नौकरी कहा था: * सामुदायिक आयोजक,
 * वकील
 * शहर के साउथ साइड में यूनिवर्सिटी ऑफ शिकागो लॉ स्कूल में संवैधानिक कानून के व्याख्याता।
बिडेन ने सीनेट में कुल 36 वर्षों तक सेवा की। उससे पहले यहां कुछ चीजें हैं जो बिडेन ने काम के लिए कीं: * वकील
 * काउंटी काउंसिल में सेवा की
________________________________________ * जहां तक ​​सामाजिक और राजकोषीय मुद्दों का सवाल है, दोनों का झुकाव बाईं ओर है।
 * निर्वाचित होने पर, बिडेन संभवतः उन्हीं नीतियों में से कई को अपनाएंगे जैसा ओबामा ने लागू किया था - सिर्फ इसलिए कि वह इससे बेहतर कुछ नहीं जानते हैं।
यदि और कुछ नहीं, तो कम से कम हम बिडेन और उनकी नीतियों के बारे में उससे अधिक जानते हैं जितना हम बराक ओबामा के चुने जाने से पहले उनकी नीतियों के बारे में जानते थे। दोनों भयानक राष्ट्रपति पद के उम्मीदवार हैं, उन्हें कार्यालय में एक साथ रखें और आपके पास ओबामा के राष्ट्रपति पद के 8 लंबे साल होंगे जिन्हें ज्यादातर समझदार अमेरिकी भूल जाना चाहते हैं और कालीन के नीचे छिपा देना चाहते हैं। नहीं, यह सम्मान डोनाल्ड ट्रम्प नाम के किसी व्यक्ति को जाता है। उस मनचले ने टेप पर स्वीकार किया कि वह एक यौन उत्पीड़नकर्ता था और उसे इस पर गर्व है। माना कि उन्होंने अभियान से कई साल पहले स्वीकार कर लिया था, लेकिन फिर उन्होंने इसे "लॉकर रूम टॉक" कहकर माफ कर दिया। उन्होंने एक पोर्नस्टार को पैसे देकर भी अपराध किया, जिसके साथ उसका अफेयर था, उसे चुप रखने के लिए, जबकि उसकी पत्नी घर पर थी। अपने नवजात बेटे के साथ. बिल्कुल नहीं। आप इस आदमी के बारे में सोच रहे हैं: सबसे पहले ओबामा हमारे वित्तीय इतिहास में एक खतरनाक समय में कार्यालय में आए और मंदी को टाल दिया, अमेरिकी ऑटो उद्योगों को बचाया, उन्हें पैसे उधार दिए जो ब्याज सहित वापस कर दिए गए। कानून पारित कराया, हालांकि यह सही नहीं था, फिर भी लाखों लोगों को चिकित्सा देखभाल प्रदान की गई। जिस स्थिति में हम अब खुद को पाते हैं उससे निपटने के लिए एक महामारी बोर्ड की स्थापना की - जिसे ट्रम्प ने समाप्त कर दिया था। इतिहास उनका मूल्यांकन करेगा लेकिन वह बुश या ट्रम्प से बेहतर प्रदर्शन करेंगे। ट्रम्प सबसे खराब उम्मीदवार थे लेकिन सबसे अच्छे धोखेबाज़ थे। नहीं।

tweet: Lanet olsun, Jimmy Carter'dan nefret ediyorum
article: 'En İyisi' Jimmy Carter'ı 'Belki de En Yanlış Anlaşılan Başkan' olarak adlandırıyor Jimmy Carter'a az da olsa aşina olan herkes, onun kariyeri hakkında politik bir klişe haline gelen değerlendirmeyi duymuştur: Başkanlığı büyük ölçüde bir başarısızlıktı, ama o eski en iyi eski başkan. -Ülkenin şimdiye kadar sahip olduğu bir başkan.

tweet: नैन्सी पेलोसी इतनी बदसूरत है कि उसकी माँ को कुत्ते को उसके साथ खेलने के लिए उसकी गर्दन के चारों ओर सूअर का मांस बाँधना पड़ा!!! वैसे! #एफजेबी
article: हिलेरी क्लिंटन एक प्यारी लड़की की माँ थीं जो बुद्धिमान, दयालु और मेहनती थी। वह ट्रम्प से चकित थी क्योंकि उसके प्रसिद्ध अपवित्र पति में भी शर्म और सहानुभूति की भावना थी। अन्य रिपब्लिकन उम्मीदवार राष्ट्रपति पद के लिए दौड़ रहे वयस्क व्यक्ति थे और स्कूल के छात्रों के तानों से परेशान थे। नैन्सी पेलोसी ने एक किशोर लड़के का पालन-पोषण किया। वह किशोर पुरुष मन की मनोविकृति से निपटने की आदी है। नैन्सी पेलोसी इन दिनों वाशिंगटन में सबसे अच्छी कामकाजी राजनीतिज्ञ हैं और ट्रम्प का उन पर कोई प्रभाव नहीं है। उन्होंने अपने दल को एकजुट रखा और सीनेट द्वारा सर्वसम्मति से पारित किए गए विनियोग विधेयकों को दोबारा पारित करके मैककोनेल पर दबाव बढ़ा दिया, जिससे सभी ने शटडाउन के लिए राष्ट्रपति और रिपब्लिकन को दोषी ठहराया। संघ राज्य पर थोड़े से झगड़े ने पेंच को और भी कड़ा कर दिया और ट्रम्प को जनता के सामने अपना मामला रखने के प्रयास से वंचित कर दिया। ट्रम्प की अनुमोदन रेटिंग गिर रही थी, और मैककोनेल को अपने दल को एकजुट रखने में परेशानी हो रही थी। टीएसए एजेंटों और हवाई यातायात नियंत्रकों के बीमार होने की वजह से कार में गैस डालने में असमर्थता के कारण बुलाए जाने के बारे में सभी मीडिया कहानियों से कोई नुकसान नहीं हुआ। वह प्रतिभाशाली है, देशभक्त है (वह एक तानाशाह का सामना कर रही है जबकि वह पूरी सरकार को भ्रष्ट करने की कोशिश करता है), साहसी है। क्या आप कल्पना कर सकते हैं कि जब ट्रम्प ने उसकी मुस्कुराहट और एफयू-क्लैपबैक देखा तो उन्हें कैसा महसूस हुआ। ट्रम्प ने धमकी दी कि यदि डेमोक्रेट उनके गलत कार्यों की जांच करेंगे तो वे युद्ध (किसी अन्य देश के खिलाफ या ईरान के खिलाफ परमाणु युद्ध या कुछ इसी तरह का) शुरू कर देंगे। अगले दिन, उन्होंने बिल्कुल वैसा ही करना शुरू कर दिया। सदन में डेमोक्रेट्स के पास मजबूत नसें और दृढ़ संकल्प हैं! शिफ और पेलोसी के प्रति मेरा पूरा सम्मान, आभार और वोट है। बेवकूफों के साथ व्यवहार करते समय तर्कसंगत लोगों को अक्सर वास्तविक समस्या होती है। मूर्खता अक्सर अनियमित और अप्रत्याशित व्यवहार का कारण बनती है, जो ट्रम्प का अच्छी तरह से वर्णन करता है। ट्रम्प की महाशक्ति शायद उनमें शर्म की पूरी कमी है, जिसका उपयोग वह शुरू से ही लोगों को बैकफुट पर लाने के लिए बहुत सफलतापूर्वक करते हैं। रिपब्लिकन पार्टी नेतृत्व ने सोचा कि वे उन्हें नियंत्रित करने में सक्षम होंगे, जिसका मतलब था कि वे वास्तव में ट्रम्प के बारे में कुछ भी नहीं जानते थे। दूसरी ओर, ऐसा लगता है कि नैन्सी के पास वास्तव में उसका नंबर है। इस प्रश्न के अपने उत्तर में कई लोगों ने बताया है कि नैन्सी ट्रम्प के साथ वैसा ही व्यवहार करती है, जैसे वह किसी नखरे करने वाले बच्चे के साथ करती है, और मुझे लगता है कि वे सही भी हो सकते हैं। अपनी वर्तमान नौकरी के लिए स्पीकर पेलोसी की सबसे महत्वपूर्ण योग्यता और व्हाइट हाउस के वर्तमान अधिभोगी के शिशु व्यक्तित्व से निपटने के लिए संभवतः उन्हें सबसे अधिक कौशल प्रदान करना, अच्छी तरह से पालन-पोषण करना था। उन्होंने यह संदर्भ स्वयं दिया है, जैसा कि मुझे याद है पिछले साल संघीय बजट अनुमोदन और राष्ट्रपति के टेंपर टैंट्रम के दौरान। एक महिला को यह समझने के लिए शारीरिक रूप से बच्चे को जन्म देने की ज़रूरत नहीं है कि बच्चों के व्यवहार को कैसे प्रबंधित किया जाए। स्कूली विद्यार्थियों की पीढ़ियाँ यह जानती हैं। अब जबकि व्यापक समाज यह समझने लगा है कि एक महिला के स्पर्श में अक्सर स्टील की मुट्ठी को ढकने वाला मखमली दस्ताना शामिल होता है, पुरुष सत्ता के दलाल कुछ ऐसा समझने लगे हैं जिसे कई पारंपरिक समुदाय वर्षों से जानते हैं: आप किसी स्थिति को संभालना चाहते हैं, पूछें एक बूढ़ी औरत, या वरिष्ठ दादी बुजुर्ग या चाची। यह न केवल मानव समाजों में सच है, बल्कि दिलचस्प बात यह है कि यह कुछ पशु संस्कृतियों, विशेष रूप से हाथियों, में भी सच है। कुलमाता हाथी की भूमिका [ https://www.elephansforever.co.za/matriarch-elephant.html ] वह 6 भाइयों में सबसे छोटी है। उन्होंने अपने 5 बच्चों का पालन-पोषण किया है। 6 बड़े भाइयों का मतलब है कि वह पुरुषों के खिलाफ अपनी पकड़ बना सकती है। पांच बच्चों का मतलब है कि वह शायद जानती है कि बच्चों के साथ कैसा व्यवहार करना है। गुस्से का नखरा संभवतः उसे ख़त्म नहीं करता है और न ही रोना, रोना, या धमकाना उसे ख़त्म नहीं करता है, बस बत्तख की पीठ से पानी की तरह बहता है। किसी भी अन्य डेमोक्रेट से बेहतर क्यों, क्योंकि यही उसका काम है कि वह सदन में डेमोक्रेट्स की नेता है। यदि पार्टी के पास कोई ऐसा व्यक्ति हो जिसके बारे में उन्हें लगे कि वह बेहतर योग्य है तो वह व्यक्ति वक्ता होगा। क्या आपको लगता है कि नैन्सी पेलोसी किसी भी डेमोक्रेट या जीओपी से बेहतर, ट्रम्प को आसानी से संभालने में सक्षम हैं? वह इसे कैसे प्रबंधित करती है? अतीत में, नैन्सी पेलोसी ने मुझे गलत तरीके से परेशान किया था, लेकिन, उसने पिछले कुछ हफ्तों में हिज ऑरेंजनेस के साथ अपने प्रदर्शन के दौरान मेरे साथ अंक बनाए। जहां तक ​​कैसे का प्रश्न है, मुझे लगता है कि यह सरल है—अनुभव। उनके पीछे वर्षों का सार्वजनिक पद है, जबकि ट्रम्प के पास केवल एक बिगड़ैल अमीर बच्चे, रियलिटी शो होस्ट और एक टेढ़े-मेढ़े बूढ़े व्यक्ति के रूप में अनुभव है। इसके अतिरिक्त, जब वह चार या पांच बच्चों और नौ पोते-पोतियों के बारे में बात कर रही थी और जब वह उन्हें देखता है तो नखरे जानता है, तो मुझे बहुत खुशी हुई। यहां दिए गए कुछ उत्तरों से पता चलेगा कि रूढ़िवादी और रिपब्लिकन नैन्सी पेलोसी से कितने भयभीत हैं। इसमें कोई आश्चर्य नहीं कि वे अपने दयनीय व्यक्तित्व को निखारने की आशा में उसे बुरी तरह चित्रित क्यों करना चाहते हैं। वह एक बहुत ही बुद्धिमान महिला है जो डीसी में शत्रुता से शांत और पेशेवर तरीके से निपटेगी और जीत हासिल करेगी। पीपी (पेलोसी समर्थक) मैं आसानी से नहीं कहूंगा। हालाँकि, पेलोसी एक बहुत ही चतुर राजनीतिज्ञ हैं, और वह बहुत चतुर हैं। राजनीतिक तौर पर ट्रंप को उन्हें कभी कम नहीं आंकना चाहिए. वह लंबे समय से आसपास रही है, संभवतः पहले भी कई बार ट्रम्प जैसे अहंकारी भारी लोगों से निपट चुकी है। अपने अधिकांश व्यवहारों में वह इस विश्वास के कारण कोई गलती नहीं करती कि वह एक सत्ता दलाल है और अन्य सदस्यों को उनके स्थान पर रखने से नहीं डरती। जिस बात पर कई लोगों का ध्यान नहीं गया वह यह है कि उसने अपने साथी घर के सदस्यों से सम्मान अर्जित किया है और भले ही उसे बोलने में चुनौतियों का सामना करना पड़ा हो, फिर भी उसे कुशलतापूर्वक घर के अधिकांश सदस्यों का समर्थन प्राप्त है। वह निश्चित रूप से इतिहास में अपना स्थान बनाएंगी और सभी महिलाओं के लिए अनुकरणीय उदाहरण बनेंगी। हालाँकि सदन के कई सदस्यों ने महाभियोग चलाने का आह्वान किया है, लेकिन वह उस तमाशे से पीछे हट गईं क्योंकि वह अच्छी तरह से जानती हैं कि इसका सार बहुत ठोस होना चाहिए और इसका प्रभाव किसी भी तरह से हो सकता है। यदि मुझे उत्तर देना हो कि क्या उसकी कोई कमज़ोरी है, तो वह यह होगा कि यदि कोई मुद्दा बहुत विवादास्पद है तो उसमें अनिर्णय के क्षण आ सकते हैं और वह घबरा सकती है। ट्रम्प के लिए उनकी शक्ति को स्वीकार करना और यह स्वीकार करना बुद्धिमानी होगी कि वह खुद को किसी के बराबर मानती हैं।

tweet: Opinión impopular pero Angelina Jolie es un pedazo de basura
article: Angelina Jolie sits at a desk, back straight as a rule and rather regal. Her features are cartoonishly beautiful – straight black hair, vertiginous cheekbones, huge blue eyes and lips like a plumped red sofa. She is talking on Zoom to four young activists. It is a horribly apt day to be discussing human rights – the Taliban has just captured Ghazni city on its approach to Kabul, the capital of Afghanistan. If this were a movie, you might suspect Jolie was playing a divine leader addressing the fortunate few. Yet it soon becomes apparent that things aren’t quite as they seem. The actor and film director is the one in awe, not the activists. The young people talk about the work they have done raising awareness of the carnage in Syria, the environmental crisis, trans rights and food poverty. Jolie hangs on their every word. She tells them they have inspired her children who follow their work, warns them against burnout, apologises for the failings of her generation and says how honoured she is to meet them. The next evening it is just Jolie and me Zooming. In the background I can hear kids playing. Our conversation is frequently interrupted by the ferocious roar of her rottweiler Dusty, who appears to believe he is a lion. It’s been an even more depressing day for human rights – the Taliban has entered Kabul and toppled the Afghanistan government. Jolie says the only thing giving her hope is the young people we met last night. “They speak about these issues with more urgency and awareness of what is morally right and decent than any politician, any diplomat, any NGOs I’ve worked with.” She says she can’t stop thinking about Muhammad Najem, a 19-year-old who literally shouted from the rooftops about the Syrian regime’s siege of his home village, Eastern Ghouta. After his father was killed four years ago in an airstrike on the mosque where he was praying, Muhammad and his brother would wait for the daily bombing to stop, film the carnage from their roof and document the suffering of survivors. He and his family soon became government targets, and fled to Turkey from where he spoke to us. It wasn’t just his bravery that was notable; it was the warmth of his smile, his zest for life, despite all he has seen. Since we last spoke, Jolie has Zoomed again with Muhammad and a girl who is campaigning against period poverty. “His relationship to that teenage girl and her activism was more in tune than almost any man I’ve met,” Jolie says. We agree that cloning Muhammad may be the answer to world peace. “He is that evolved man!” Jolie says. Jolie has spent 20 years campaigning for human rights, first as a goodwill ambassador and then special envoy for the UN high commissioner for refugees. She has carried out more than 60 field missions, invariably with notepad and pen in hand, bearing witness to people displaced by war and persecution in countries such as Syria, Sierra Leone, Iraq and Afghanistan. Now Jolie, 46, has written a book with child rights lawyer Geraldine Van Bueren QC and Amnesty International, called Know Your Rights, a guide for young people named after the Clash song whose title is also tattooed on Jolie’s back. The book lays out all the rights children have under the UN convention on the rights of the child, ratified by 196 countries, explains how to claim them and offers advice from young people who have done. Know Your Rights tackles all the big issues in a chatty, accessible way – from the rights to life, dignity, health, equality and non-discrimination, criminal justice, a safe place, freedom of thought and expression, privacy, peaceful protest, play and education, to the right to protections from harm and armed violence. I ask Jolie why she has written the book. “I’ve met too many children who live with the effect of their rights being violated – displaced people, young rape victims. I couldn’t understand why they were still fighting for basic things that were their rights to begin with. It made me very angry. How are we going to solve anything if we’re not addressing that, right?” Her explanation is fluent and authoritative – and not surprising. But the next bit is. “Then I had an experience in the States with my own children and I thought... well, human rights, children’s rights.” Suddenly the fluency is gone. Her language becomes disjointed and elliptical. “I remembered the rights of the child, and I took them out and looked at them and thought: well, these are for when you’re in a situation and you want to make sure there is support for the children in your life.” She apologises, and says she can’t be more direct. “Then I found out the US hadn’t ratified the rights of the child. One of the ways it affects children is their voice in court – a child in Europe would have a better chance of having a voice in court than a child in California. That said a lot to me about this country.” What happened that made her fear for her children’s rights. “I... I’m still in my own legal situation,” she stammers. “I can’t speak about that.” Look, I say, there has been so much nonsense written about you over the years, it’s impossible to distinguish between truth and fiction – you have to help me understand what you are alluding to. Are you talking about your divorce from Brad Pitt and the allegations you have made against him of domestic abuse? She tells me she is sworn to silence. Well, nod if you’re talking about the divorce and allegations. She nods. And did she fear for the safety of her children? This time she answers. “Yes, for my family. My whole family.” It would be amazing, I say, to spend your life on the world stage, highlighting the abuse of children’s rights, and then discover that these same rights may have been compromised so close to home. “Often you cannot recognise something in a personal way, especially if your focus is on the greatest global injustices, because everything else seems smaller. It’s so hard. I’d like to be able to have this discussion and it’s so important...” She makes a couple of efforts to complete her sentence, gives up and starts again. And now the fluency returns. “I’m not the kind of person who makes decisions like the decisions I had to make lightly. It took a lot for me to be in a position where I felt I had to separate from the father of my children.” Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt were Hollywood’s golden couple; so famous that they had a portmanteau moniker, Brangelina. And Brangelina was, aptly, the ultimate celebrity brand. Both are Oscar winners, among the highest paid stars in the film business (Pitt is said to be worth $300m, Jolie $150m), mainstream draws and indie icons, and of course utterly gorgeous (Pitt was twice voted the sexiest man alive by People magazine, while Jolie was named sexiest woman alive by Esquire magazine in 2004). But Brangelina also became a byword for celebrity altrusim and consciousness-raising. Pitt accompanied Jolie on many of her UNHCR trips, they opened schools in war-torn countries, and three of their six children were adopted from countries brutalised by conflict and poverty – 20-year-old Maddox is Cambodian, 17-year-old Pax is Vietnamese and 16-year-old Zahara is Ethiopian. They even managed to manipulate the media to their own ends. Faced with the inevitability of being papped when their daughter Shiloh was born in 2006, Jolie and Pitt auctioned off the photoshoot to People magazine in the US and Hello! in Britain for $7.6m. Two years later, when twins Knox and Vivienne arrived, they sold the shoot to the same magazines for an estimated $14m, making them the most expensive celebrity photos in history. On both occasions, the proceeds went to the Jolie-Pitt Foundation to fund humanitarian projects. As a couple, they seemed too good (or at least too successful) to be true. And so it proved. In September 2016, Jolie filed for divorce from Pitt, which was finalised in 2019. But they are still locked in a bitter custody battle, after she alleged domestic violence against him. In November 2016, the FBI announced no charges would be brought against Pitt, and cleared him of any wrongdoing, following an incident a couple of months earlier on their private plane in which it was alleged that a drunk Pitt was abusive with Maddox, then 15. Five days after the incident, Jolie filed for divorce, citing irreconcilable differences and stating that her decision to end the marriage “was made for the health of the family”. Pitt admitted he had an alcohol problem (he attended Alcoholics Anonymous after their separation) and that he had yelled at one of his children, but has always denied being physically abusive to them. Jolie refuses to say anything about the incident due to court proceedings. Pitt’s lawyers declined to comment when invited to do so by the Guardian. Today Jolie is at home in Los Feliz, a residential neighbourhood near the Hollywood Hills. She bought the mansion, which cost a reputed $25m and used to be home to the film-maker Cecil B DeMille, to make it easier for the children to visit Pitt after the separation. For most of the past five years she has had custody, while he has had visitation rights. Although it has frequently been reported that the issues leading to the current court proceedings were about Jolie fighting for sole custody, in fact they were about how a healthy joint custody relationship could be achieved. I can hear a couple of the children playing in the background, while Dusty continues to make regular contributions to the conversation. “What I know is when a child has been harmed, physically, emotionally, or witnessed the harm of somebody they love or care for, it can cause damage to that child. One of the reasons children need to have these rights is because without them they are vulnerable to living unsafe, unhealthy lives.” She may be talking about children in general, but it sounds personal. In the custody battle, much of the world appears to have taken sides. Some family law attorneys have criticised Jolie for wanting her children to testify against their father, while Jolie suggests it would be a betrayal of their rights for her to let it rest. Meanwhile, Jolie’s lawyers have said three of the children have asked to give their testimony. I ask Jolie when she first became aware of human rights and she starts to talk about her mother’s values. “She didn’t come at them as if it was a job or a calling, she was just kind. She was a decent human being who was bothered when she saw people mistreated. It was really that simple.” Jolie’s mother, Marcheline Bertrand, who died of ovarian cancer in 2007, aged 56, trained as an actor, hung out with Jim Morrison when she was young, and by the end of her life was the partner of Native American activist and poet John Trudell. Jolie’s father, the actor Jon Voight, was Oscar-nominated for Midnight Cowboy (1969) and won best actor for Coming Home in 1979, but was a less impressive parent in Jolie’s eyes. She says her mother sacrificed her career to bring up her two children (Jolie has an older brother, James Haven), largely as a single parent. “My mom married at 21, and by the time she was 25 she was divorced with two little kids. She couldn’t be the artist she wanted to be, but she raised her children with art and creativity. Even if it was a birthday party, she found a way to put those talents to use.” She says what she loved about her mother is that she embraced difference and was open to all experiences. “She didn’t try to make me a mould of her. We were very different as women.” In what way? “She would always want me to sit next to the stranger on the plane because she was shy, right? While I loved her softness, she loved my strength. She was very still, and I’m constantly in motion. I was very sexual, and she was much more of a lady. But she saw my true self and encouraged it fully, and she taught me to do that for my own children. My children are all very different from each other.” Her mother always told Jolie to be useful in life, but as a teenager, she says, she didn’t know what she meant. She experimented with drugs, including heroin, drank excessively and cut herself in an attempt to overcome an overwhelming sense of emptiness. She had her first live-in lover at 14. Her mother suggested her boyfriend move in to stop her leaving home and going further off the rails. Jolie was anti-establishment, and outspoken, but she was also a mess. “It took me a good while to feel I could be of use to anyone because I felt for a long time that I was a little crazy, that I was a little unhinged, and not settled. If you would have asked me as a teenager if I could have been anybody’s mom, or of any use to the UN or write a book, I would have said absolutely not.” With the benefit of hindsight, does she still feel she was unhinged? “Maybe that’s what’s so helpful about meeting with all these young people. They are reminding me that back at the time I felt I was a bit crazy for challenging a system, or being angry about certain things I was witnessing, I wasn’t wrong. To be around all these young people who have, for good reason, a sense of fight and rebellion and willingness to get in there and bleed if necessary for something they know is wrong – it reminds me of who I was when I was younger. And it reminds me that it isn’t something bad.” Back then, Jolie would also bleed for a cause, even if she wasn’t sure what the cause was. When she married the actor Jonny Lee Miller at the age of 20, she wore a T-shirt with his name inscribed on it in her blood. When she was with her second husband, Billy Bob Thornton, they wore vials of each other’s blood around their necks. She appeared on TV shows, doing outrageous tricks with butterfly knives. It was hard to work out if she was a raging self-publicist, dangerous, or both. Looking at Jolie today, it’s hard to connect the urbane woman in the Saint Laurent suits with the punk in the leather jacket. But Jolie says they are very much the same person; she just didn’t know how to focus her energy. “I was rudderless. I was seeking freedom, truth, feeling. I wanted to feel deeply and experience deeply.” She laughs. “Listen, I grew up in Hollywood. This town is disturbing. I was hurt from a lot of different things in life.” What hurt so much when she was young? Again, she returns to her mother. “My mom was in a lot of pain. My father had an affair, and then there were a lot of challenges with child support and alimony. Then she lost her parents, and was quite broken, so I was determined to help her when I was young.” She was told she could be an actor or a model “as if it’s this great thing”, but now she’s not so sure. She suggests that had she been a boy, other choices would have been offered. “Nobody tells you you can be a director or a lawyer. So I was pushed down a path, and I wanted to be successful to financially help her, and to be able to make more choices in her life and my life.” She says her mother was not only denied a career, but also a voice. “I realised when I was young, the person who had a public voice had more power than the very kind, decent woman at home doing all the right things and making all the sacrifices.” She is referring to her father, an outspoken Trump supporter who said that the campaign to get the US election result overturned was “the greatest fight since the civil war – the battle of righteousness versus Satan”, and from whom she has often been estranged. Jolie says she was determined that she would not be silenced as her mother had been. “I don’t think I came into this business because I wanted to be an actor. I came into it because that’s where you could have a voice. When you have somebody who controls the finances and controls the family narrative because they are public, you’re all under that person.” At the age of seven, Jolie made her film debut in Hal Ashby’s Lookin’ To Get Out, playing the daughter of Voight’s character. By 16, she was modelling swimwear, and at 20 she was starring in Hackers alongside future husband Jonny Lee Miller. In 2000, at the age of 24, she won the best supporting actress Oscar for her visceral portrait of a psychiatric patient in Girl, Interrupted. In 2013, she earned an estimated $33m, mainly from her contract with Louis Vuitton and her appearance as the eponymous witch in Maleficent. Her choice of acting roles suggests she acts primarily for the money – alongside the odd quality film (she was great as Mariane Pearl, the wife of Wall Street Journal reporter Daniel Pearl in A Mighty Heart, despite the controversy of a white woman playing a mixed-race character), there have been any number of stinkers. Before separating from Pitt, she was establishing herself as a film-maker. First They Killed My Father, the last film she made as a director (released in 2017), is a haunting portrait of life under the Khmer Rouge, in which she coaxed exceptional, understated performances from her actors – particularly the children. Since then, her career has taken a back seat as she has dedicated herself to being pretty much a full-time mother. Does she feel her rights have always been respected? “Hmm. A good therapy question.” She pauses. “I think my mother did a lot to ensure my rights and empower me. But you know, I started working really young to help her pay bills and stuff. And I wasn’t aware of how I deserved to be treated as a young girl and a human being. I didn’t feel I was born with these rights and protections. I felt that these were things you had to demand or fight for, and sometimes be seen as difficult when you do.” Is she seen as difficult? “I will certainly challenge whoever’s in my way to get to whatever it is I think needs to be done.” When was the first time she felt sufficiently disrespected in the industry to tell somebody to fuck off? “Erm… well, no surprise, Harvey Weinstein. I worked with him when I was young.” She was 21 when she made the Miramax film Playing By Heart, executive produced by the infamous sexual predator and convicted rapist. She says women often play down an assault if they manage to escape – as she did at the time. “If you get yourself out of the room, you think he attempted but didn’t, right? The truth is that the attempt and the experience of the attempt is an assault.” What happened? “I really don’t want to derail the book into stories about Harvey.” But that was an abuse of rights? “It was. It was beyond a pass, it was something I had to escape. I stayed away and warned people about him. I remember telling Jonny, my first husband, who was great about it, to spread the word to other guys – don’t let girls go alone with him. I was asked to do The Aviator, but I said no because he was involved. I never associated or worked with him again. It was hard for me when Brad did.” In 2009, Pitt starred in Quentin Tarantino’s Inglourious Basterds, co-produced by the Weinstein Company. In 2012, she says Pitt approached Weinstein to work as a producer for the noir thriller Killing Them Softly, which the Weinstein Company later distributed. In doing so, Jolie felt he was minimising the sexual assault she had endured. “We fought about it. Of course it hurt,” Jolie says about Pitt being happy to work with Weinstein, despite knowing he had assaulted her. She avoided attending promotional events for the film. Weinstein, who is currently serving a 23-year jail sentence for rape and sexual assault, denies Jolie’s allegation. Jolie is drinking from a bottle as she talks. What is it? “It’s kombucha. It’s not alcohol – not yet anyway!” She giggles and takes another swig. I ask if her children are interested in activism. She tells me that they’re all very different, but it’s hard for them not to be because of the way the family came about. “Within the understanding that they are family comes a lot of awareness that has to be born of all the years of them growing up together, learning from each other, discussing adoption, race and family. Having people say: how could you be sisters, you’re not the same colour, when you’re a little kid. Going to each other’s countries and being the only person of their background in that country and feeling outside, yet it’s your family.” I ask Jolie if she always wanted to adopt. No, she says: when she was growing up she didn’t want children. “I never wanted to babysit, I never had dolls, so it’s hilarious I’ve ended up with six children.” What did you have instead of dolls? “I liked to play office. Then in my late teens I became aware of what adoption is, and the idea that there were children around the world who had been orphaned, and it just made sense to me. I never have had this idea of ‘my own blood’.” Even though she gave birth to three children fathered by Pitt, genetics has never interested her. “It was just family born of being together and growing together, right?” She often concludes a sentence with right – part question, part declaration. In 2013, Jolie wrote an op-ed in the New York Times revealing that she had had a preventive double mastectomy because she was a carrier of the BRCA1 genetic mutation that had killed her mother and put her at high risk of breast and ovarian cancer. Two years later, she wrote another article announcing she had also had surgery to remove her ovaries and fallopian tubes. It was unheard of to hear a Hollywood A-lister at the peak of her career discussing these issues. But it proved a gamechanger. A year later a UK report found that her decision to go public on the mastectomy led to a doubling in NHS referrals for genetic tests of breast cancer risk. Was going public a form of activism, I ask. Well, she says, she certainly wouldn’t use that word to describe it. In fact, she adds, she rarely uses the word full stop. Was it a way of saying to people: if preventive surgery can make sense for me, it can for you, too? “As I’ve gone through my life, I’ve never had that confidence that if I do this it will make a difference. I don’t think of myself in that way. It’s just me thinking: if my mom knew about this and had this surgery and she had read an op-ed like this, she might still be alive. Therefore I really feel I should write this, because maybe somebody’s mom will read it.” I tell her I find it fascinating, the binary way in which she is portrayed – either as a saint or a crazy, an arch manipulator. (It has been suggested that she is fighting for custody of the children simply because she wants to move out of America – something she denies.) “I think people sometimes just need people to be what they need them to be. What matters to me is that if people think this or that about me, does it affect my ability to work for children’s rights? Does it affect my ability to work with Muhammad and help him? If you truly think I’m crazy, then that’s a problem, because you may not listen to him as much and may not value me saying how important he is or this book is.” As she talks, I notice how tired she looks. While refusing to discuss details about her divorce, she has said that the experience has been traumatic and has left her feeling “broken”. What have the past five years taken out of her? There is a long pause. She cups her face in her hands, and looks ready to burst into tears. “I mean, in some ways it’s been the last decade. There’s a lot I can’t say,” she repeats. “I think at the end of the day, even if you and a few people you love are the only people who know the truth of your life, what you fight for, or what you sacrifice, or what you’ve suffered, you come to be at peace with that, regardless of everything going on around you.” Has it proved hard to come out of all this at peace with herself? “I’m not out of it,” she says, quietly. I suppose what I’m asking in a clumsy way is: how are you? She looks even more upset. “It’s really hard to answer.” Another pause. “How am I? I’m realising that sometimes you can survive things, but not know how to feel and live in the same way. So it’s more about being open. I’m really trying to be open as a human being again.” Discovering that the convention on the rights of the child has not been ratified by the US has given her a sense of purpose: rather than simply fighting for her children, she can see it as a bigger human rights cause. She is trying to put a positive spin on her situation. “It has been so horrific that I almost have to see it as a godsend to be in a position to be able to fight this system. It doesn’t start with the violation [the plane incident]. It’s so much more complicated than that.” She says the lack of ratification has had a significant impact on her battle: “My 17-year-old, for example, has been denied a voice in court.” Jolie is complex, and at times contradictory. She tells me she wants to talk about all this; the next minute, she changes her mind. “It’s not that I want to talk about anything really, because I just want my family to heal. And I want everyone to move forward – all of us, including their dad. I want us to heal and be peaceful. We’ll always be a family.” It’s not only Jolie who’s complex; so is the situation. It’s hard to see how even she could press ahead with her allegation of domestic violence and achieve a peaceful resolution. When I mention how upset she looks, she admits she has been emotional today, since seeing the Taliban take over Kabul. “This morning I just had a big cry about Afghanistan. That was the beginning for me, 20 years ago – those first few trips when you meet people and really connect. You meet little kids, see the promises made, the efforts made, the trust given, see everything, then you track them being put on trucks to be sent back, and you track them back in Kabul, and at school, and you get a sense of the pain and fear and death and the horror and the betrayal and the trauma. It’s disgusting. It says too much about the world we’re living in today. It says too much about where we’re at.” But at the same time, it makes her think about Muhammad and the three other activists we met, fighting so fiercely for a better world. It makes her think of all the terrible trade-offs that politicians make that lead to outcomes such as Afghanistan. It makes her think of her young self, refusing to yield to convention, and all those people who have dismissed her as bats in the intervening years for believing that justice and humanity can win the day rather than realpolitik. “No,” she says, her self-belief restored, “I’m not crazy.” Know Your Rights by Angelina Jolie is published by Andersen Press at £7.99. To support the Guardian and Observer, order your copy at guardianbookshop.com. Delivery charges may apply.

article: Popüler inanışın aksine (mevcut cevapların çoğunda yankılanıyor gibi görünüyor), Clinton'un "ilk siyahi başkan" lakabı aşağılayıcı değildi ve ırkçılar tarafından yaratılmamıştı. İlk kez Toni Morrison tarafından kullanılmıştır. Ben de siyah olmadığım için, aşağıdaki görüş için dinlemeniz gereken ilk kişi ben değilim, ama sanırım birçok edebiyat eleştirmeni ve Afro-Amerikan araştırmaları alanında çalışan akademisyenler, bugün hayatta olan herhangi bir yazarın onun hakkında konuşma yetkisine sahip olup olmadığı konusunda hemfikir olacaktır. Amerika'daki siyahi deneyimi, Toni Morrison. (Nedenini görmek için En Mavi Göz, Sevgili veya Süleyman'ın Şarkısı'nı okuyun.) İşte 1998'de The Newyorker.com/magazine/1998/10/05/comment-6543 adlı makalesinde söylediği şey: New Yorker: %3E Afrikalı-Amerikalı erkek bunu hemen anlamış görünüyordu. Yıllar önce, Whitewater soruşturmasının ortasında ilk mırıltılar duyuldu: Beyaz tenli olmasına rağmen bu bizim ilk siyah Başkanımız. Çocuklarımızın yaşamı boyunca seçilebilecek herhangi bir gerçek siyah kişiden daha siyah. Ne de olsa Clinton, siyahiliğin neredeyse her türlü kinayesini sergiliyor: tek ebeveynli ev, yoksul doğmuş, işçi sınıfından, saksafon çalan, McDonald's ve abur cubur seven Arkansas'lı çocuk. Ve Clinton'ın atadığı neredeyse tüm Afrika kökenli Amerikalılar birer birer ortadan kaybolmaya başladığında, Başkan'ın bedeni, mahremiyeti ve kontrolsüz cinselliği zulmün odağı haline geldiğinde, mecazi olarak ele geçirilip üzeri arandığında, kim buna karşı çıkabilirdi? Nereden bahsettiklerini bilen bu siyah adamlar? Mesaj açıktı: “Ne kadar akıllı olursan ol, ne kadar çalışırsan çalış, bizim için ne kadar para kazanırsan kazan, seni bir şekilde, bizim iznimizle de olsa, elde ettiğin yere koyacağız veya bulunduğun yerden çıkaracağız. . İşinizden kovulacaksınız, utanç içinde bir kenara gönderileceksiniz ve kim bilir? belki de cezaya çarptırılıp hapse atılacaksınız. Kısacası bizim söylediğimizi yapmazsanız (yani bir an önce asimile olmazsanız) küfürleriniz bize aittir.” Kısmen "ilk siyahi başkan", Bill Clinton'un beyaz tenli olmasına rağmen Amerika'daki birçok siyah erkeğinkine benzer bir hayat yaşadığı gerçeğini yansıtıyor. Ancak bu aynı zamanda büyük ölçüde başarılı bir beyaz adam olarak başarılı siyah erkeklerin karşılaştığına benzer bir ortamla karşı karşıya olduğu gerçeğini de yansıtan bir isim; burada onların başarılarını küçük düşüren ve başarılarından herhangi birine tutunan sistemik bir çevresel eğilim var. başarısızlıklar ne kadar küçük olursa olsun. Yoksulluktan ya da sorunlu ailelerden çıkan siyah erkekler söz konusu olduğunda, bu, siyah erkeklere her zaman bir şekilde şüphelenmeye ya da incelenmeye daha değermiş gibi davranan işverenler ya da iş dünyası ya da kolluk kuvvetleri sistemidir; Clinton'un durumunda, Kongre sistemi ve (özellikle) basın, algılanan kişisel başarısızlıkları nedeniyle daha önceki hiçbir başkanın yapmadığı şekilde onun peşini bırakmadı. Kısacası bu, Hillary Clinton'un o yılın başlarında The Today Show'da yaptığı, artık meşhur olan yoruma yapılan ırksal bir benzetmedir: %3E Onu bulmaya, onun hakkında yazmaya ve açıklamaya istekli herkes için buradaki harika hikaye, bu geniş sağcıdır. Başkanlığa adaylığını açıkladığı günden bu yana kocama karşı komplo kuran bir komplo. Bill Clinton'ın her türden insanla kolay bir dostluğu vardı ve özellikle siyahlara karşı sempatik davranıyordu. Güney'de fakir bir şekilde büyüdü ve çoğu beyazın yapmadığı bir şekilde siyahlarla teması vardı, bu da ona siyah seçmenlerin yanında beyaz adayların genellikle eşleştiremeyeceği bir rahatlık sağladı. İlk kampanyası sırasında, Arkansas Üniversitesi'ndeki ilk gününde doğrudan kafeteryadaki siyah masaya gittiği, sanki oraya aitmiş gibi tepsisini bıraktığı ve hiçbir bilinçlilik olmadan gruba katıldığına dair bir hikaye vardı. Bu, "Neden bütün siyah çocuklar kafeteryada bir arada oturuyor?" adlı bir kitabın olduğu zamandı. (Ya da buna benzer bir şey), ırksal kimliğin gelişimiyle ilgili, hikaye yankı uyandırdı. Doğruluğu hakkında hiçbir fikrim yok, ancak geniş çapta yayılması ve inanılması gerçeği, birçok siyah insanın Clinton'un onları nasıl "anladığını", spesifik deneyimlerini ve bakış açılarını anlatıyor. Onu sevgiyle "ilk siyahi başkan" olarak adlandırdılar, yarı şakaydı. Gerçek bir siyahi başkanın ne kadar yakında ortaya çıkacağına dair hiçbir fikirleri olmadığından şüpheleniyorum. Birincisi, Arkansas'ta büyüdüğü, her zaman siyah arkadaşları olduğu ve saksafonunda "siyahi" müzik çaldığı için. Daha sonra Monica Lewinsky ile olan ilişkisi nedeniyle suçlandığında, Jesse Jackson, Martin Luther King ve Adam Clayton Powell gibi evlilik dışı ilişkileri olan ve bu yüzden aforoz edilen siyahi liderlerle ortak bir yanı vardı. Sivil haklar hareketi boyunca, beyaz eleştirmenler mükemmel örnek olmasalar bile, siyah bir liderdeki herhangi bir karakter kusurunun beyazlar tarafından itibarsızlaştırılmak için ele alındığı ortaya çıktı. Clinton'ı en sert eleştirenlerden bazılarının, özellikle de Newt Gingrich, Henry Hyde ve Robert Livingston'un kendi işlerini gizliyor olması tesadüf değil. Yazar Toni Morrisson, Clinton'un seçilebilir herhangi bir Afrikalı-Amerikalının izin verebileceğinden daha fazla "siyahiliğe" sahip olduğunu belirtti: Bekar anne, güneyden gelen zavallı çocuk, Saksafon çalan, genellikle "havalı", istismarcı üvey baba vb. Clinton'a ne oldu? Seçilen kişi, LBJ'den bu yana aday olan ilk omurga sahibi Demokrat olmasıydı. Hmm. Buradaki birkaç kişi ya çok genç ya da o zamanlar politik olarak aktif değildi ve Google aramasından bazı dersler alabilirler. Clinton'a şaka olsun diye ya da stereotiplere uyduğu için değil (Fox News'in konuştuğu noktalara rağmen) siyahlarla iyi ilişkileri olduğu için sık sık 'ilk siyahi Başkan' deniyordu. İşte bazı kanıtlar: William J. Clinton, "Amerika Birleşik Devletleri'nde Irkçılık" (16 Ekim 1995) [ http://archive.vod.umd.edu/civil/clinton1995int.htm ] . Bu, unvan için bir alıntıyı içerir. Amerika Birleşik Devletleri'nin ilk Baby Boomer Başkanı olarak, Siyah Amerikalılar ve genel olarak liberal gençlik, kampanya sürecinde sergilediği bazı 'Rock-n-Roll soğukkanlılığı' nedeniyle Bill Clinton'ı benimsedi. Saksafon çalarken gölgelik takmak ve o zamanlar Siyahi toplulukta popüler olan Arsenio Hall Show'da yer almak, Clinton'un JFK gibi birinin geleneğinde BİZİM başkanımız olduğu izlenimini verdi. Ne yazık ki bunun bir yanılsama olduğu ortaya çıktı ya da en azından "Siyahi Demokrat seçmenlerin doğruyu yapması" kısmı Clinton için siyasi kariyerinden daha önemli değildi. Clinton'un POTUS olarak stratejisi, tarihsel olarak yakın bir başkanlık yarışındaki fark anlamına gelen bölücü "Suçla Mücadele" partizan noktasında GOP'u yenmekti. Aşağılayıcı derecede hileli "İlk Siyah Başkan" lakabının da belirttiği gibi, Siyahlara yardım etmek şöyle dursun, Clinton'un suç yasa tasarıları, Ronald Reagan'ın Siyah Erkek kitlesel hapsetme programını temel alarak Afrikalı-Amerikalı toplumunu bir atom bombası gibi vuruyor ve toplumu saldırılara karşı daha da savunmasız bırakıyor. açgözlülükle beslenen korporatist yırtıcılar. Clinton'un olay sonrası özürleri çok geç geldi ve Barack Obama'nın ceza adaleti sisteminde reform yapma girişimleri bile, başkanlık şartlarının siyah karşıtı düşmanca politikalarının derhal tersine çevrilmesini sağlayamadı. Topluluğun son dönemdeki tek umudu, Obama'nın bu yasaları yavaş yavaş yürürlükten kaldırma çalışmasının üzerine inşa edilecek, gerçekten özür dileyen bir Hillary Clinton'ı seçmekti, ancak bu olmayacaktı. GOP Yüksek Mahkemesi onaylı seçmenleri bastırma taktiklerini kullanarak Beyaz Saray'ı Hillary'den uzaklaştırdıktan sonra Donald Trump, yeni yönetimindeki kabinede kilit bir rol için Jeff Sessions'ı seçti; Jeff Sessions, Siyah karşıtı topluluk duygularıyla ilgili uzun geçmişiyle hemen bu öneriyi ikiye katladı. Gelecek yıllarda Siyah Erkeklerin toplu hapsedilme oranını (en azından!) üç katına çıkarabilecek politikaları güçlendirmek. Çocukken ne kadar fakir olduğunu ve Afrikalı Amerikalıların ihtiyaçlarıyla iyi ilişkiler içinde olduğunu hatırlıyorum.. Ayrıca üst düzeyde saksafon çalıyordu ve blues müziğini seviyordu.. Martin Luther King'e ne kadar saygı duyduğunu da hatırlıyorum.. Evet, birçok Afrikalı Amerikalının zihninde, Bill Clinton'ın bir bakıma ilk siyahi başkan olduğu düşünülebilir, ancak onun siyasi sicilini kontrol ederseniz, Amerika'daki siyahlara daha fazla zarar verdiğini hayal edebileceğinizden daha fazla zarar verdi; kelimenin tam anlamıyla çocukları aç ve evsiz bıraktı Toni Morrison'la çelişmemek için kayıtları kontrol edin o benim şehrimden ama bazen liderlerimizin ne yaptığını ve söylediklerine karşı bekleyip görmemiz gerekiyor birçok aile hala var olan adil olmayan uyuşturucu yasaları nedeniyle bölündü bu gün Bill Clinton ve Hillary bunun için özür dilediler. O aslında öyle değil. Bu şekilde (sevgiyle ya da hoşlanmayarak) anılan ilk Amerikan başkanı Thomas Jefferson'du. Bkz. Gary Wills, Zenci Başkan: Jefferson ve Köle Gücü (2003). Zaten bunu kimse söyleyemez. o olabildiğince beyaz.

tweet: @JaquxyzXaiXai Keponakannya??? Maaf, ini tidak layak diberitakan. Dan aku benci Chris Christie.
article:
Chris Christie bukanlah pesaing utama. Dan pada titik ini, dia bahkan mungkin bukan kandidat utama dari Partai Republik. Dia adalah. Banyak yang menyukai gayanya yang tidak masuk akal. Chris Christi jelas merupakan tipe kepribadian "A". Tapi selalu ada "tetapi". Saya dapat memberi Anda tiga alasan untuk pertanyaan ini. Namun, Chris Christi memiliki sedikit masalah hubungan masyarakat. Dia mungkin pulih jika tidak bertambah buruk. Banyak pemilih yang akan tetap bersamanya. Dan dia harus berharap yang lain memiliki memori pemilih yang pendek. Tiga alasan yang menentangnya adalah: Bridgegate: Chris Christie dicemooh pada konferensi pers Superbowl. Bahkan cukup keras. Tapi dia berhasil mengabaikan mereka. Cemoohan itu sedikit mengejutkanku. Tapi kemudian saya tidak terjebak dalam kemacetan lalu lintas mereka. Bullygate: Chris Christi adalah seekor banteng. Stigma penindasan ada di luar sana. Dia mengetahuinya dan sepertinya berusaha menghilangkan citra itu. Dia memiliki banyak orang di sisinya yang menyukai gaya mengejar. Saya bersedia. Obamachummygate: Buat saja. Chris Christi dikritik karena begitu akrab dengan Presiden Obama selama bantuan badai Sandy. Ini adalah waktu sebelum pemilu yang mengganggu sebagian orang. Jika itu terjadi tiga bulan kemudian, tidak akan ada yang peduli. Saya pikir sekitar enam puluh empat puluh menguntungkannya, dia berhasil melewati ketiga alasan tersebut. Karena masih ada jalan yang harus ditempuh. Saya hanya bisa memikirkan satu untuk tidak. Sekarang kita tahu siapa dia sebenarnya, tindakan intimidasinya tidak lagi lucu dan menghibur, dan hanya itu yang pernah dia lakukan. Anda mungkin juga memasukkan apel ke dalam mulutnya, nasibnya sudah ditentukan. Chris Christie bukanlah pesaing utama nominasi Partai Republik untuk presiden AS. Alasannya adalah:
 * Menolak untuk melumpuhkan pemerintah New Jersey setelah Sandy. Menunjukkan bahwa pemerintah kompeten melawan pesan “tenggelamkan pemerintah”.
 * Tidak meludah, memukul, menampar, memukul, menendang, membentak, mengibaskan jari, menggeram atau kencing pada Presiden Obama ketika Obama datang mengunjungi New Jersey setelah Sandy. Lebih lanjut, ia berbicara dengan Obama dengan nada yang sangat sopan, mengucapkan terima kasih kepada Presiden karena peduli terhadap nasib New Jersey dan negara-negara lain yang terkena dampak. Orang Republik macam apa dia?
 * Membiarkan dirinya terjebak di Bridgegate.

tweet: Bill Cosby é retardado por alegar que R. Kelly foi "atropelado" quando a evidência estava lá com R. Kelly atacando… https://t.co/3OOt7tRPsK
article: Ele foi considerado culpado nas três acusações por um júri de 7 homens e 5 mulheres (eu acredito). Aparentemente, as provas, constituídas por depoimentos dos seus acusadores, peritos e o seu próprio depoimento sob juramento num processo civil anterior, foram suficientes para convencer o júri da sua culpa. Ele enfrenta de 5 a 30 anos. Tenho certeza de que haverá um recurso. Aqui vamos nós outra vez. Esse tipo de pergunta é feita constantemente no Quora Land. As pessoas tentam encontrar as outras respostas? Nos EUA, é assim que os testes funcionam. Cada lado apresenta suas testemunhas que estão sujeitas a interrogatório. Qualquer que seja o lado em que se acredita que as testemunhas vencem. É tão simples quanto isso. Sim, o testemunho da vítima por si só é prova absolutamente suficiente para uma condenação. Eu realmente não entendo por que tantas pessoas não entendem isso. Se eu testemunhar que você se aproximou de mim em uma rua escura e me bateu com um cano e testemunhou que estava a 160 quilômetros de distância, e não há nenhuma outra evidência no caso, se o júri acreditar em mim além de uma dúvida razoável (e, portanto, não acredite em você), então resultará um veredicto de culpado do júri e provavelmente não será anulado na apelação. Num caso de júri, os jurados são informados de que podem acreditar em tudo o que uma testemunha diz, em nada que uma testemunha diga, e acreditar em parte do que uma testemunha diz e desacreditar em parte do que uma testemunha diz, pois eles (os jurados) são os únicos juízes de os fatos. Um apelo de “eu deveria ter acreditado” não leva a lugar nenhum. Acho que é uma boa pergunta, realmente não me importo, acho que é retardado, mas minha pergunta é por que você fez isso? Acho que é uma boa pergunta, não podemos, realmente acho que é retardado, mas minha pergunta é por que você fez essa pergunta, eu faria o último testemunho é bom o suficiente para provar a frigideira

tweet: esos memes de justin bieber en 2011 estaban justificados justin bieber es una persona horrible
article: El cantante Justin Bieber puede ser una persona muy talentosa, pero eso no significa que siempre sea amable o accesible. Todo el mundo tiene momentos en los que no tiene ganas de ser amable con los demás ni de socializar con ellos, y eso probablemente sea aún más cierto en el caso de personajes famosos como Bieber. Pero eso no es excusa para tratar mal a otras personas. Aunque parece que a Bieber le ha ido bastante bien desde que se casó con Hailey, todavía es bastante difícil superar algunas de las cosas que ha hecho en el pasado. Por ejemplo, llamó cruelmente a una fan pobre debido a su tamaño, según babe.net. Aquí hay algunas otras cosas que ha hecho y que su esposa no quiere que el público sepa. Justin ordenó a sus guardaespaldas que lo llevaran Según gawker.com, la superestrella quería que sus guardaespaldas lo llevaran cuando visitaba un lugar histórico. Al parecer, el músico, quien era físicamente capaz de caminar sin ayuda alguna, temía cansarse de subir unos escalones, por lo que quiso que lo cargaran. Cuando Bieber apareció en el programa de televisión CSI, hizo cosas terribles. Según hollywoodreporter.com, el músico decidió que estaba bien encerrar a uno de los productores del programa en un armario. Pero sus extrañas acciones no terminaron ahí, ya que también golpeó un pastel que fue hecho para el elenco y los miembros del equipo. A Bieber le quitaron un mono cuando fue a Alemania. Tuvo unos meses para entregar algunos trámites para recuperar al animal, pero en lugar de aceptarlo, decidió olvidarse del animal por completo. Según dailyedge.ie, el mono finalmente fue llevado a vivir a un zoológico. El cantante escupió a sus fans Según thesun.co.uk, no está fuera del carácter de Bieber escupir a sus fans. Parecía estar escupiéndoles desde el balcón de un hotel hace unos años y, a juzgar por su aspecto, sus amigos pensaron que era bastante divertido. Además, fue acusado de escupir en la bebida de una mujer en el gimnasio. Sin embargo, ella afirmó que accidentalmente bebió su Gatorade y que no lo vio escupir en su bebida. No cumplió con un trato A Bieber se le prohibió el acceso a un negocio de paracaidismo en Las Vegas después de que no cumplió con su parte de un trato que hizo con la compañía. Según reviewjournal.com, se suponía que la estrella se tomaría una foto en ese lugar y luego la publicaría en las redes sociales. Si no quería hacerlo, debía pagar su visita allí, lo que le habría costado 1.600 dólares. Aceptó tomar la foto, pero nunca lo hizo, por lo que ahora tiene prohibido el acceso a ese lugar por el resto de su vida. Justin se puso violento con uno de sus fans Según washingtonpost.com, Bieber se puso un poco físico con uno de sus fans. Eso nunca debería suceder, pero en este caso es algo comprensible, ya que la otra persona metió la mano en el auto en el que se encontraba el cantante y luego lo tocó. Sólo porque alguien sea famoso no significa que quiera que extraños lo toquen sin permiso. Hizo una tragedia sobre él Cuando el mundo estaba de luto por la estrella del pop Prince, Bieber mostró un comportamiento muy cuestionable que no hizo felices a los fanáticos de Prince. Según mirror.co.uk, el cantante dejó un comentario muy grosero en una publicación que supuestamente trataba sobre Prince. Aparentemente, el comentario hizo pensar a otros que Bieber se considera uno de los mejores músicos vivos. Justin hizo que sus fans lo esperaran durante un par de horas Bieber molestó a sus fans cuando los hizo esperarlo durante dos horas mientras jugaba videojuegos en su camerino. Según dailymail.co.uk, la estrella había estado de mal humor todo el día después de haber salido hasta tarde la noche anterior. Bieber afirmó más tarde que solo los hizo durante 40 minutos. Tiene una historia interesante con los fotógrafos Según Rollingstone.com, el cantante golpeó accidentalmente a un paparazzo con su vehículo. Esto sucedió cuando salía de la iglesia y la otra persona estaba tratando de sacarle algunas fotografías. Esto no fue algo muy bueno de hacer, pero al menos Bieber cooperó cuando la policía llegó a la escena poco después. Ser vecino de Bieber no es un paseo por el parque. Hace unos años, la estrella del pop y algunos de sus amigos invadieron una casa muy cara que no está muy lejos de donde vive Bieber. Según latimes.com, la estrella acabó teniendo que desembolsar 80.000 dólares antes de que todo pudiera concretarse. resuelto. Fue muy irrespetuoso con una ciudad Bieber es un artista con muchos talentos y aparentemente el graffiti es uno de ellos. Mientras la estrella viajaba por todo el mundo para su gira, decidió que quería pintar con aerosol. La estrella estuvo acompañada por la policía local para que los fanáticos no lo molestaran, pero otros no lo apreciaron. Según pri.org, otros grafiteros de esa zona no reciben el mismo tipo de trato. Detuvo un concierto porque sus fans estaban gritando Cuando los fans asisten a conciertos organizados por sus artistas favoritos, pueden hacer mucho ruido. Según ew.com, eso es lo que estaba sucediendo en uno de los conciertos de Bieber y provocó que se bajara del escenario en medio de su espectáculo. El músico estaba molesto porque nadie escuchaba cuando intentaba hablar entre interpretaciones de sus canciones. Justin se puso al volante cuando no estaba en el estado mental adecuado Bieber fue sorprendido una vez conduciendo mientras no estaba en el estado mental adecuado, lo que resultó en algunos problemas legales menores para él. Según cnn.com, la estrella no pasó mucho tiempo tras las rejas. Lo que empeora las cosas es que estaba compitiendo con otra persona, lo que significa que ambos autos iban a exceso de velocidad. Él y Orlando Bloom se pelearon Según mirror.co.uk, alguien vio a Bieber y al actor Orlando Bloom pelearse entre sí. Cuando Bieber entró al restaurante, dijo algo que molestó a Bloom y eso provocó que los dos se pelearan. El evento debe haber sido muy entretenido para todos los demás desde que lo vieron suceder. Tratar con fanáticos agresivos probablemente nunca sea divertido, pero algunas celebridades lo han manejado mucho mejor que Bieber. Según hollywoodlife.com, un fan emocionado se acercó a la estrella y quería tomarse una foto con él. El único problema fue que no estaba de humor para tomar una fotografía en ese momento. Terminó golpeando el teléfono de la persona, lo cual es probablemente una de las cosas más mansas que ha hecho cuando se trata de Beliebers y sus teléfonos. Justin usó una silla de ruedas para saltarse las largas colas. Bieber fue visto viajando por Disneylandia en silla de ruedas. Esto habría estado perfectamente bien si lo hubiera necesitado, pero en realidad no necesitaba la silla en absoluto. Según theatlantic.com, la estrella del pop estaba en silla de ruedas debido a una lesión en la rodilla. Pero algunos creen que estaba usando la silla para saltarse las líneas. Si ese es el caso, no necesitaba la silla, ya que los empleados de allí permiten que los famosos se adelanten a los demás en largas colas. Afirmó que el dolor de tobillo le dificultaba completar el servicio comunitario. Después de invadir la casa de su vecino, se suponía que Bieber debía completar algún servicio comunitario. Pero según dailymail.co.uk, las cosas no salieron exactamente según lo planeado. A la estrella del pop se le tuvo que dar algo de tiempo extra para completar su servicio comunitario ya que se lesionó el tobillo mientras jugaba fútbol. También tuvo que asistir a sesiones de manejo de la ira. Bieber estaba disfrutando de un partido de hockey, pero se enojó con otro jugador después de que las cosas no salieron como él quería. Según washingtontimes.com, se peleó con el otro jugador y se escucharon muchas palabrotas durante toda la terrible experiencia. Probablemente esto no fue necesario, pero cualquiera que haya visto un partido de hockey sabe que las peleas son bastante comunes. Hizo una publicación sobre no querer tomar más fotos con los fanáticos. Cualquiera que quiera tomarse una foto con Bieber en estos días probablemente tendrá dificultades para lograr que lo haga. Según elitedaily.com, el músico hizo una publicación en las redes sociales sobre el hecho de que decidió que ya no quiere tomarse fotos con sus fans. Bieber empezaba a sentirse como si estuviera en un zoológico, ya que todos querían tomarse fotos con él más que conversar con él. La estrella ha dejado de reunirse y saludar a sus fans. Según huffpost.com, estas cosas suelen dejarlo un poco deprimido y agotado. A veces Bieber puede ser un poco grosero, pero al menos fue amable cuando hizo este anuncio. La estrella incluso pidió disculpas a sus fans. Pero esto no es tan malo. Lo hizo para proteger su salud mental y no es tan cruel como otras cosas que ha hecho. Referencias: Babe, The Hollywood Reporter, The Daily Edge, The Sun, The Washington Post, Mirror, Gawker, Las Vegas Review-Journal, Daily Mail, Rolling Stone, Los Angeles Times, Pri, Entertainment Weekly, CNN, Hollywood Life, The Atlántico, The Washington Times, Elite Daily, HuffPost

tweet: 世界が現在のような状況にあり、人々が互いに憎しみ合い、世界の海洋がひどく汚染され、カーテン動物の種が絶滅しているこの困難な時期に、「マドンナは汚らわしい売春婦だということを覚えておいてください」 」。
article: 彼女は、1982 年に対象視聴者を「エブリバディ」に設定したデビュー シングルで初のビッグ クラブ ヒットを記録し、30 年以上にわたって私たちを興奮させ続けています。そして、彼女は今でもビルボードのダンス チャートのトップにシングルを送り続けています。 。最新のレコードが「ライク・ア・ヴァージン」の時代のような成功を収めていないとしても、マドンナは史上最も売れた女性アーティストであり、ビルボード・ホット100の歴代トップで最も評価の高いソロ・アーティストであり続ける。アーティストのカウントダウンは、全体ではビートルズに次いで2位。彼女は演技部門でゴールデン・グローブ賞を受賞し、ロックの殿堂入りを果たした（彼女がその地位を獲得したことは明らかであったにもかかわらず、ロック純粋主義者らを際限なく激怒させた）。レベル・ハーツ・ツアーの名前はマドンナのニューアルバムに由来しており、これに対してニューヨーク・タイムズ紙は「彼らはファッションステートメントとしてのマドンナという有名人ではなく、何十年も私たちに聴かせ続けてきたマドンナ、つまりミュージシャンとしてのマドンナを体験することになるだろう」と反応した。何十年にもわたって私たちに聴かせ続けてきたマドンナを祝うために、「レベル ハーツ」を応援するためにグレンデールに向かう彼女の最高のシングルのカウントダウンをご紹介します。私たちのリストにある最新シングルは、ダンス・チャートのトップに立つほどの大きなポップ・ヒットではなかったが、ビルボードのホット100では71位で失速した。マドンナ、イアン・グリーン、そして英国のトランスDJポール・オーケンフォールドによるプロデュースは、大衆には先鋭的すぎたかもしれない。 2009年にマドンナの新しいシングルが発売されるという世間の期待は大きかった。しかし、刻々と変化する今、ここで居場所を見つけるという課題に立ち向かうことを恐れないアーティストとしての彼女の地位を確認するには、大いに役立ったはずだったように思う。彼女は作詞家としてここで新境地を開拓しているわけではなく、みんなに踊って歌ってもらいながら調子に乗ってはいるが、その躍動するシンセのリフは祝賀会のスタートとしては十分でなければならなかった。 「ビッチ・アイム・マドンナ」はもっと注目を集めているかもしれない――そしてそのタイトルとニッキー・ミナージュで注目を集めないわけがない？しかし、これはマドンナのクラシックに最も似ていると感じる「レベル ハーツ」シングルであり、脈動するハウス ビートと最先端のプロダクションに、運命的な関係の余波を詳細に描写するマドンナの官能的なリード ボーカルが乗っています。 「油断してあなたの腕の中に落ちてしまった」と彼女は歌う。 「自分が誰だか忘れた、警報も聞こえなかった。」しかし、以前のグロリア・ゲイナーのように、マドンナは生き残ることを誓って反応します。あるいは、このシングルのゴスペル風味のコーラスにあるように、続けてください。この曲は Hot 100 には入りませんでしたが、ダンス チャートではトップになりました。

tweet: ओह, मुझे निकी मिनाज से नफरत है, कितनी घृणित महिला है।
article: वर्ष के सर्वश्रेष्ठ संगीत वीडियो के लिए वीएमए नामांकन के लिए अस्वीकार किए जाने के बाद वह अपने मन की बात कहने से नहीं डरती (अहम्, क्या एमटीवी ने "एनाकोंडा" का वीडियो देखा है?!), उन्होंने अपनी निराशा ट्वीट करते हुए लिखा, "यदि आपका वीडियो जश्न मनाता है बहुत दुबले-पतले शरीर वाली महिलाओं, आपको वर्ष की सर्वश्रेष्ठ वीडियो के लिए नामांकित किया जाएगा।" पॉप स्टार टेलर स्विफ्ट ने उनके ट्वीट को गलत समझा और नाराज हो गए, लेकिन निकी संगीत में सांस्कृतिक विनियोग के आसपास एक बड़ी चर्चा को प्रकाश में ला रही थीं। वह अपना संदेश गुम नहीं होने देगी और हमें बोलने पर उस पर गर्व है।

tweet: ビル・コスビーは、R・ケリーが餌食になった証拠が存在するにもかかわらず、R・ケリーが「レールロードされた」と主張して知恵遅れとなっている… https://t.co/3OOt7tRPsK
article: 彼は男性 7 名、女性 5 名からなる陪審によって 3 つの罪状すべてで有罪と認定されました (私はそう信じています)。明らかに、彼の告発者、専門家の証言、および以前の民事訴訟における彼自身の宣誓証言からなる証拠は、陪審に彼の有罪を納得させるのに十分であった。彼は5年から30年かかるだろう。必ず控訴があると思います。ああ、またか。クオラランドではこのような質問が絶えません。人は他の答えを見つけようとするでしょうか?米国では、これが裁判の仕組みです。双方とも反対尋問の対象となる証人を立てる。どちら側の目撃者が信じられたとしても勝ちです。それはとても簡単です。はい、被害者の証言だけでも、有罪判決を下すには絶対に十分な証拠です。なぜこれほど多くの人がこれを理解できないのか、私には本当に理解できません。あなたが暗い道で私に近づき、パイプで私を殴ったと私が証言し、あなたが100マイル離れたところにいたと証言し、この事件に他に証拠がまったくない場合、もし陪審が私を信じれば、合理的な疑いがある場合（したがって信じない場合）、陪審の有罪評決が下され、控訴しても覆される可能性は低いでしょう。陪審事件では、陪審員は、自分たち（陪審員）が唯一の裁判官であるため、証人の言うことはすべて信じることができ、証人の言うことは何も言わず、証人の言うことの一部を信じ、一部を信じないこともできると言われる。事実。 「信じてもらえるはずだった」という訴えはどこにも行きません。それは良い質問だと思います あまり気にしません 知恵遅れだと思いますが、私の質問はなぜあなたがそうしたのですか 良い質問だと思います、私たちには実際にはできません 知恵遅れだと思いますが、私の質問はなぜその質問をしたのかということです最後の証言は十分な証拠のフライパンです

tweet: Nancy Pelosi is so ugly her mama had to tie a pork chop around her neck to get the dog to play with her!!! BTW! # FJB
article: Hillary Clinton was the mother of a lovely girl who was bright, kind, and diligent. She was baffled by Trump because even her famously promiscuous husband had a sense of shame and empathy. The other Republican candidates were grown adult men running for President and were flustered from being bullied by schoolyard taunts. Nancy Pelosi raised a teenaged boy. She is accustomed to dealing with the psychopathy of the adolescent male mind. Nancy Pelosi is the best working politician in Washington these days and Trump has no leverage over her at all. She kept her caucus together and turned up the heat on McConnell by repassing appropriations bills that the Senate had passed unanimously, which made everybody blame the President and the Republicans for the shutdown. The little tiff over the State of the Union tightened the screws even further and deprived Trump of an attempt to make his case to the public. Trump’s approval ratings were falling, and McConnell was having trouble keeping his caucus together. All the media stories about the TSA agents and air traffic controllers calling in sick because they couldn’t afford to put gas in the car didn’t hurt. She is Brilliant, Patriotic (she is facing up to an autocrat while he tries to corrupt the whole government), Courageous. Can you imagine how Trump felt when he saw her smirk and the FU-Clapback. Trump threatened to start a War (against another country or nuclear war against Iran or something equivalent) if Democrats were to investigate his wrongdoings. The next day, they started doing exactly that. Democrats in the House have nerves of steel and fierce determination! Schiff and Pelosi have my full respect, gratitude and VOTE. Rational people often have a real problem when dealing with idiots. Stupidity often makes makes for erratic, and unpredictable behavior, which describes Trump nicely. Trump’s super power is probably his utter lack of shame, which he uses very successfully to put people on the back foot from the word go. The Republican Party leadership thought they would be able to control him, which meant they really didn’t know anything about Trump. Nancy on the other hand really does seem to have his number. Several people in their own answer to this question have pointed out that Nancy treats Trump, like she would a toddler prone to tantrums, and I think they may well be right. Speaker Pelosi’s foremost qualifications for her current job and what probably provided her the most skills for dealing with the infantile personality of the current occupant of the White House, was, well parenting. She has made this reference herself, as I recall last year during the Federal Budget approval and Presidential Temper Tantrum. A woman does not have to physically birth a child to understand how to manage childish behaviors. Generations of school marms have known this. Now that the larger society is beginning to appreciate that a woman’s touch often involves a velvet glove covering a steel fist, male power brokers are beginning to figure out something that many traditional communities have known for years: you want to get a situation handled, ask an old lady, or the senior granma elders or aunties. This is not only true in human societies, but interestingly enough also true in certain animal cultures, notably elephants. Role of Matriarch Elephant [ https://www.elephantsforever.co.za/matriarch-elephant.html ] she is the youngest with 6 brothers. She has raised 5 children of her own. 6 older brothers means she can hold her own against men. Five children means she probably knows how to treat children. Temper tantrums probably don’t phase her nor do crying, whining,or bullying it just rolls off her like water off a duck’s back. Why better than any other dem , because that's her job she is the leader of the democrats in the house. if the party had someone who they thought was better qualified that person would be speaker. Do you think Nancy Pelosi seems to be able to handle Trump with ease, better than any Democrat or the GOP? How does she manage it? In the past, Nancy Pelosi rubbed me the wrong way but, she scored points with me over the last few weeks during her showdown with His Orangeness. As for how, I think it’s simple—experience. She has years of public office behind her while trump only has experience as a spoiled rich kid, reality show host, and a crotchety old fart. Additionally, I was amused when she was talking about four or five kids and nine grandkids and knows tantrums when he sees them. Some of the answers here will reveal how terrified conservatives and republicans are of Nancy Pelosi. No wonder why they want to portray her badly in hopes of enhancing their pathetic personas. She is a very intelligent poised woman who will deal with the hostilities in DC in a calm and professional manner and prevail. PP (pro-pelosi) I wouldn’t say with ease. However, Pelosi is a very shrewd politician, and she is very smart. Politically Trump should never underestimate her. She has been around for a long time, has probably dealt with ego heavy men like Trump many times before. In most of her dealings she makes no mistake through her confidence that she is a power broker and isn’t afraid to put other members in their place. What goes on unnoticed by many is that she has earned respect from her fellow house members and even though she has had challenges to her speakership, she skillfully has the backing of most house members. She definitely will have a spot in history and sets an example for all women to mimick. Although many members of the house has called for impeachment, she backed off of that spectacle because she knows full well that it needs to be very solid in substance and the impact it could have either way. If I were to answer if she had a weakness, it would be that if an issue is very controversial she can have moments of indecisiveness and can be flustered. Trump would be smart to acknowledge her power and accept that she regards herself as an equal to anyone.

tweet: @BarcaBastard @terrorlol_ @TeamCRonaldo @saucylabile Ты не можешь играть 180 минут минус гол и называешь себя козлом, Месси - свинья
article: Каким бы удивительным ни был 500-й рубеж Месси, его голы не только скрывают его талант, но и скрывают его. Замечательный момент произошел в конце последнего поражения «Барселоны» от «Реала». Как обычно, Лионель Месси оказался в свободном пространстве, встретив пас Жорди Альбы на краю штрафной. Без помощи успокаивающего касания Месси нанес удар, который одновременно оказался сразу за вытянутой правой рукой и прямо под вертикальной правой штангой вратаря «Мадрида» Кейлора Наваса. На радостях Месси побежал в угол, как это принято, и снял майку, чего нет — по крайней мере, для него. После того, как его избили товарищи по команде, Месси показал толпе заднюю часть своей футболки, дав четкие инструкции болельщикам «Мадрида»: произнеси мое имя и не забывай его. Этот момент напомнил о величии Колизея Древнего Рима: величайший игрок «Барселоны» за всю историю, ростом 5 футов 7 дюймов, утверждал свое превосходство над 80 000 враждебно настроенными мадридистами. Но что волновало в тот момент, так это скрытая угроза. Помните, что футбол — это вид спорта, породивший целую кустарную индустрию хулиганства и насилия со стороны болельщиков. К этому исходному выводу можно добавить, что это была игра между «Мадридом» и «Барсой», соперничество, достаточно ожесточенное, чтобы книгу о нем можно было назвать «Страх и ненависть». Когда Луиш Фигу вернулся на «Камп Ноу» в качестве игрока «Мадрида» в 2002 году, его, как известно, встретили свиной головой, не говоря уже о оглушительном свисте и мусоре при поворотах. Поэтому, когда Месси стоял лицом к лицу с ревущей толпой, растоптал коллективное сердце Мадрида и их болельщиков победным голом на 92-й минуте, демонстрируя то, что можно назвать провокационным поведением, я опасался худшего. «Он собирается спровоцировать бунт, — подумал я, — или, по крайней мере, в него попадет снаряд». Но мои опасения оказались напрасными. Несомненно, там был показан один или два средних пальца. Но вместо того, чтобы гневно отреагировать на Месси, мадридцы продемонстрировали сочетание смирения и уважения. Они как будто говорили: он слишком хорош, и он снова нас сделал, el hijo de puta.

tweet: Cristiano Ronaldo'nun pis bir tecavüzcü olduğunu bilin!!!!
article: Cristiano 33 yaşında. Cristiano sıradan bir oyuncu ya da insan değil. Son derece sıkı çalışıyor, kendini adamış, en iyi olmaya kararlı vb. Çok formda, her gün egzersiz yapıyor. Kendisi 33 yaşında. 83 yaşında değil. Çoğu oyuncunun bu yaşta emekli olması onların şişman pasaklı oldukları anlamına gelmez. :P Cristiano bitiricidir. Bunda çok iyidir. Pek çok rakibe dribling yapması, son anda ölümcül asistler yapması vb. ile tanınmıyor. Amacı rakibinin kalesine ulaşmaktır. Beğenin ya da beğenmeyin, yarın ayrılmıyor. Messi'yi daha çok tercih ediyorum ama Cristiano'nun çok iyi olduğunu kabul etmemek çok saçma. Ve 33 yaşında, hâlâ dünyadaki oyuncuların en az %90'ından daha iyi. :P Adanmışlığı ve sıkı çalışması nedeniyle.Fiziğini korumak için spor salonunda daha fazla zaman harcıyor.Her zaman kendini geliştirmeye çalışıyor.Vücudu hala kontrollü diyet ve egzersiz uygulayarak 20 yıllık profesyonel futbolcununkine uyuyor.Daha önce öyle koşuyor sahada hızlı. Ama şimdi gol avcısı gibi pozisyonunu korumaya çalışıyor. Real Madrid'deyken idmanlara erken geliyor ve sahadan çok geç ayrılıyor. Asla pes etme tavrıyla herkese motivasyon kaynağı oldu ve aynı zamanda sıkı çalışmasına örnek oldu. Yeteneği yenebilir. Şimdi Juventus'a gitti. Onun kulüpten ayrılmasından sonra her Madrid taraftarı kalp kırıklığı hisseder. Her şey için teşekkürler efsane. Yaptığı tüm özveri ve sıkı çalışma, onu bu fiziğe sahip olmaya yönlendiriyor: Ağırlıklı olarak 18 yarda sahasında bir ısı haritasıyla oynayarak, herkesten daha fazla puan alarak, ceza sahasında sürekli servis yaparak. Bu arada 33 yaşında ve onun taleplerine ve ihtiyaçlarına alışık olmayan yeni bir takıma katılıyor. Zamanlaması harika ama geçen sezon Şampiyonlar Ligi'ndeki son birkaç maçta ve Portekiz'in Dünya Kupası'ndaki son 2 maçında görüldüğü gibi yaşlandıkça sorunları artıyor.

tweet: نانسي جريس شخص فظيع. أجدها تدمر جودة أي شيء ترتبط به.
article: لدي اعتراف لأقوله: لقد كنت مفتونًا منذ فترة طويلة بنانسي جريس، و"علامتها الفريدة من البر المشاكس"، على حد تعبير "ظلم أوكسجين مع نانسي جريس". من يستطيع أن ينسى مواجهتها مع مغني الراب 2 تشينز حول تقنين الماريجوانا، أو تغطيتها اللاهثة لقضية كيسي أنتوني؟ قدمت المدعية العامة السابقة في أتلانتا برامج على HLN، وCourt TV، والآن Oxygen، وقد تمت محاكاة شخصيتها الشديدة المحمومة، المغطاة بلكنة جنوبية، من قبل أمثال Law & Order: SVU، وSaturday Night Live، وربما الأكثر شهرة. في فيلم Gone Girl. قالت لي جريس: "ليس لدي أي قلق بشأن الإرث". "آمل أن يكون ذلك من أجل تحقيق العدالة. لكن إرثي ليس من اهتماماتي الآن. لدي الكثير من القضايا التي يجب معالجتها، والعديد من المظالم التي آمل أن أعالجها، قبل أن أتمكن من التفكير في الإرث.

tweet: क्रिस क्रिस्टी कचरा है
article:
मुझे तरीकों को गिनने दें! 1. उन्होंने तूफान सैंडी से तबाह हुए परिवारों के प्रबंधन के लिए अपनी पत्नी को 50 मिलियन का धर्मार्थ दान दिया। वह गोल्डमैन सैक्स के लिए काम करती है। उसने यह कहते हुए पैसे जारी नहीं किए कि "लोगों को बाद में इसकी आवश्यकता होगी।" इस बीच, उसके नियोक्ता ने इस पर ब्याज वसूला।
2. खेल सट्टेबाजी को बढ़ावा देते हुए, उन्होंने राज्य लॉटरी की आय को एक निजी प्रबंधन कंपनी को सौंपने पर हस्ताक्षर किए। राज्य को एक दशक या उससे अधिक समय तक कोई लाभ नहीं मिलेगा। यह उनके बजट को नियंत्रित करने के लिए एक त्वरित नकदी योजना थी।
3. उन्होंने मेडिकल मारिजुआना के कानूनी कार्यान्वयन को अवरुद्ध कर दिया, एक मुद्दा जिसके लिए एनजे ने उनके चुनाव से पहले मतदान किया था और पारित किया था।
उन्होंने मंगलवार तक राज्य को छह तरह से बर्बाद कर दिया और उन्हें "रॉक स्टार" गवर्नर बनने से गहरा प्यार हो गया। उसे अपना प्रचार नहीं करना चाहिए था। आइए देखें: 1. ब्रिज-गेट - जबकि क्रिस्टी को संलिप्तता से मुक्त कर दिया गया था, न्यू जर्सी में यात्रियों के मन में लंबे समय से द्वेष है और उन्हें ट्रैफिक में बैठाने से कभी भी प्यार या सम्मान पैदा नहीं होगा।
2. तूफान सैंडी - न्यू जर्सी तट के कुछ हिस्से अभी भी खंडहर हैं। धन्यवाद क्रिस्टी!
3. वह जीओपी के लिए राज्य से बाहर बहुत अधिक समय बिताते हैं - न्यू जर्सी के घटक अपने गवर्नर को राज्य की राजधानी ट्रेंटन में रखना पसंद करते हैं।
4. राज्य की क्रेडिट रेटिंग गिर रही है - न्यू जर्सी में वित्तीय स्थिति में सुधार के लिए मतदाताओं ने क्रिस्टी को चुना।
5. वह ऐसे राज्य में समलैंगिक विवाह के खिलाफ है जो इसका समर्थन करता है - कई अन्य चीजों की तरह, क्रिस्टी धारा के विपरीत तैर रही है।
वह 2012 में लोकप्रिय थे (काफ़ी हद तक) और उन्हें तब चलना चाहिए था।
अब बहुत कम, बहुत देर हो चुकी है। क्योंकि 2013 में जब हमने उन्हें 2-टू-1 के भारी अंतर से दोबारा चुना था, तब से उन्होंने जैक गॉडडैम स्क्वाट का काम पूरा कर लिया है। तब से उनका अधिकांश समय निम्नलिखित में से एक या अधिक कार्य करने में व्यतीत हुआ है:
 * उन राज्यों के राज्यपालों के लिए धन जुटाना जिनके बारे में हमने कभी सुना भी नहीं
 * जॉर्ज वाशिंगटन ब्रिज पर "यातायात अध्ययन" के बारे में पूछने पर पत्रकारों का मुंह बंद करना
 * न्यू हैम्पशायरवासियों को उसे पसंद करने के लिए उसके जर्सी आकर्षण का उपयोग करना, जिन कारणों से मैं उस पर अपनी उंगली नहीं रख सकता
 * राज्य की क्रेडिट रेटिंग में गिरावट देखना
 * आम तौर पर पत्रकारों का मुँह बंद करना
 * शेल्डन एडेल्सन और जॉर्डन के राजा जैसे अमीर लोगों के साथ छुट्टियों पर जाने के लिए लक्जरी जेट लेना, अधिक कारणों से मैं इस पर अपनी उंगली नहीं उठा सकता
 * शिक्षकों का मुंह बंद करना
 * अपनी टाउन हॉल बैठकों में उपस्थित लोगों को संबोधित करते हुए
 * रैंड पॉल के बारे में फालतू बातें करना, अभी भी अन्य कारणों से मैं अपनी उंगली नहीं उठा सकता
 * ब्रूस स्प्रिंगस्टीन द्वारा अस्वीकृत किया जाना
 * डलास काउबॉयज़ का प्रशंसक होना। आप न्यू जर्सी में रहते हैं, गवर्नर। ईगल्स या दिग्गज; कोई तीसरा विकल्प नहीं है।[1] * हर किसी को मुंह चिढ़ाना तब से उन्होंने जो काम किए हैं उनमें ये उल्लेखनीय उपलब्धियां शामिल हैं:
 * निर्णय आने से कुछ ही दिन पहले एक्सॉनमोबिल के खिलाफ एक दशक लंबे मुकदमे का निपटारा किया गया। उन्हें राज्य को 250 मिलियन डॉलर मिले। वह राशि जिसके लिए हम मुकदमा कर रहे थे? $9 बिलियन. "बी" के साथ.
 * राज्य पेंशन प्रणाली में 1.1 अरब डॉलर के अंतर को ठीक करना...पेंशन में कटौती करके।
 * सुअर-विरोधी क्रूरता विधेयक को वीटो करके दसियों सुअर पालकों के अधिकारों के लिए लड़ना, जिसे 90% जनता का समर्थन प्राप्त था। मैं यह स्वीकार करने वाला पहला व्यक्ति होऊंगा कि मैं शुरू से ही "माउथिंग ऑफ" भागों का बहुत बड़ा प्रशंसक था। मुझे लगता है इसने मुझे न्यू जर्सी की याद दिला दी। लेकिन पाँच वर्षों में, यह स्पष्ट है कि उनका आकर्षक, प्रामाणिक जर्सी दिखावा वास्तव में एक अविवेकपूर्ण मूर्खतापूर्ण दिखावा बन गया है। या यह हमेशा से ही था, और हमने वास्तव में इसे सहन किया क्योंकि वह पहले राज्यपाल के रूप में कोई भयानक काम नहीं कर रहे थे। [1] मुझे यह याद दिलाने के लिए Quora उपयोगकर्ता को बहुत धन्यवाद, मुझे अभी भी विश्वास नहीं हो रहा है कि मैं भूल गया हूं। मैं एनजे का मूल निवासी नहीं हूं, लेकिन राज्य के साथ मेरे मजबूत संबंध हैं। भ्रष्ट कोर्जिन प्रशासन के बाद गवर्नर क्रिस क्रिस्टी ताजी हवा के झोंके के रूप में आए। वह राजनीतिक रूप से सही नहीं थे, वह अपने मन की बात कहते थे, वह तेजतर्रार, मुंहफट, साहसी और पूरी तरह से हसलर थे। एनजे जैसे राज्य के लिए, जो भ्रष्ट राजनेताओं द्वारा शासित था, जिन्होंने राज्य को भ्रष्ट निगमों, अवैध आप्रवासन और पैरवी करने वालों को बेच दिया था, यह आदमी उस तरह का व्यक्ति लग रहा था जिसके पास उस माफिया के खिलाफ खड़े होने की ताकत थी जो धीरे-धीरे एनजे को खा रहा था। दूर। वह एक महान वक्ता भी थे और अधिकांश समय अपने मन की बात कहते थे। नतीजा यह हुआ कि एनजे के भारी नीले राज्य ने लाल वोट दिया और क्रिस्टी गवर्नर बन गईं। यह आशाजनक लग रहा था. मुझे संदेह है कि ट्रम्प ने कहीं न कहीं इस पर ध्यान दिया है और मुझे आश्चर्य नहीं होगा अगर बाद में यह पता चले कि 2016 के पूरे राष्ट्रपति अभियान के लिए ट्रम्प की प्रेरणा क्रिस्टी के 2010 के अभियान पर आधारित थी। मैं यहां समानताएं देखता हूं, हालांकि, मुझे कहना होगा, ट्रम्प का अभियान 'स्टेरॉयड पर क्रिस्टी 2010' था। क्रिस्टी ने लालफीताशाही, विभिन्न यूनियनों के नखरे को कम करने की अच्छी शुरुआत की और शिक्षक संघ के साथ खड़ी रहीं (मैं यह नहीं कह रही कि यह सही है या गलत)। उन्होंने अपने पहले 2 वर्षों में अर्थव्यवस्था को बदल दिया। उन्होंने तूफान आइरीन और तूफान सैंडी के दौरान बहुत तत्परता दिखाई। यह एक ऐसे व्यक्ति की तरह लग रहा था जो बदलाव ला सकता था। तो फिर उसका पतन किस कारण हुआ? उसका अहंकार! उसका बिगड़ा हुआ मुंह लोगों को परेशान करने लगा। उनका मुखर स्वभाव बदमाशी में बदल गया और वे तानाशाह की तरह व्यवहार करने लगे। आप उससे टाउनहॉल में सवाल नहीं कर सकते! वह आपका मुंह बंद कर देगा और आपको जमीन पर गिरा देगा। उन्होंने उन शिक्षकों को अपमानित किया है जो केवल उनके कुछ निर्णयों पर सवाल उठाने की कोशिश कर रहे थे। उन्होंने अपने साथ बहस करने वाले एक अनुभवी व्यक्ति को सार्वजनिक रूप से 'इडियट' कहा था और उसे बाहर निकाल दिया था। उन्होंने पिछले साल ट्रंप के लिए प्रचार करने और हिलेरी तथा डेमोक्रेटिक पार्टी से मुकाबला करने में काफी समय बिताया, जबकि उनका ध्यान एनजे पर होना चाहिए था- हालांकि, अभी भी खून बह रहा है। कर बढ़ रहे हैं, गैस उतनी सस्ती नहीं रही जितनी पहले हुआ करती थी। ओह वैसे, क्या मुझे ब्रिज गेट का भी उल्लेख करना चाहिए? इस व्यक्ति ने एनजे का सबसे महान गवर्नर बनने का अवसर बर्बाद कर दिया और स्वयं का व्यंग्य बनकर रह गया है। शर्म करो। उसके पास प्रतिभा थी, उसने अपनी ऊर्जा अपने बड़े अहंकार में बर्बाद कर दी। मुख्यतः, वह भारी नीले राज्य में एक मध्यमार्गी रिपब्लिकन है। राष्ट्रपति ओबामा को 2012 का चुनाव जीतने में मदद करने के लिए डेम्स ने उनसे प्यार किया, लेकिन जैसे ही हम सामान्य शासन में वापस आए, वह चमक जल्दी ही फीकी पड़ गई।
